00025 /// This is a base class for event loops that are derived from rootana.
00026 /// 
00027 /// The user should create a class that derives from this TRootanaEventLoop class 
00028 /// and then fill in the methods that they want to implement.
00029 ///
00030 /// The user must implement the method ProcessMidasEvent(), which will get executed 
00031 /// on each event.
00032 /// 
00033 /// The user can also implement methods like Initialize, BeginRun, EndRun, Finalize
00034 /// if there are actions they want to execute at certain points.
00035 ///
00036 /// The event loop will work in both offline and online mode (online only if the user has MIDAS installed).
00037 /// 
00038 /// In example of this type of event loop is shown in examples/analyzer_example.cxx
00039 ///
00040 class TRootanaEventLoop {
00041  
00042 public:
00043   virtual ~TRootanaEventLoop ();
00044 
00045 
00046   static TRootanaEventLoop& Get(void);
00047   
00048   /// Method to get the data container that event loop owns.
00049   TDataContainer* GetDataContainer(){return fDataContainer;};
00050 
00051 
00052   /// The main method, called for each event.  Users must implement this
00053   /// function!
00054   virtual bool ProcessMidasEvent(TDataContainer& dataContainer) = 0;
00055   //virtual bool ProcessEvent(TMidasEvent& event) = 0;
00056 
00057 
00058   /// Called after the arguments are processes but before reading the first
00059   /// event is read
00060   virtual void Initialize(void);
00061   
00062   /// Called before the first event of a file is read, but you should prefer
00063   /// Initialize() for general initialization.  This method will be called
00064   /// once for each input file.  
00065   virtual void BeginRun(int transition,int run,int time);
00066   
00067   /// Called after the last event of a file is read, but you should prefer
00068   /// Finalize() for general finalization.  This method will be called once
00069   /// for each input file.
00070   virtual void EndRun(int transition,int run,int time);
00071   
00072   /// Called after the last event has been processed, but before any open
00073   /// output files are closed.
00074   virtual void Finalize();
00075 
00076   /// Called when there is a usage error.  This code should print a usage
00077   /// message and then return. 
00078   virtual void Usage(void);
00079   
00080   /// Check an option and return true if it is valid.  
00081   /// The return value is used to flag errors during option handling.  If
00082   /// the options are valid, then CheckOption should return true to indicate
00083   /// success.  If there is a problem processing the options, then CheckOption
00084   /// should return false.  If this returns false, then the event loop will
00085   /// print the Usage message and exit with a non zero value (i.e. indicate
00086   /// failure).
00087   virtual bool CheckOption(std::string option);
00088 
00089   /// Are we processing online data?
00090   bool IsOnline() const {return !fIsOffline;};
00091   
00092   /// Are we processing offline data?
00093   bool IsOffline() const {return fIsOffline;};
00094   
00095   /// Current Run Number
00096   int GetCurrentRunNumber() const {return fCurrentRunNumber;};
00097 
00098   /// Current Run Number
00099   void SetCurrentRunNumber(int run) {fCurrentRunNumber = run;};
00100 
00101   /// Method to actually process the Midas information, either as file or online.
00102   int ExecuteLoop(int argc, char *argv[]);
00103 
00104   int ProcessMidasFile(TApplication*app,const char*fname);
00105 
00106 #ifdef HAVE_MIDAS
00107   int ProcessMidasOnline(TApplication*app, const char* hostname, const char* exptname);
00108 #endif
00109 
00110 
00111   /// This static templated function will make it a little easier
00112   /// for users to create the singleton instance.
00113   template<typename T>
00114   static void CreateSingleton()
00115   {
00116     if(fTRootanaEventLoop)
00117       std::cout << "Singleton has already been created" << std::endl;
00118     else
00119       fTRootanaEventLoop = new T();
00120   } 
00121   
00122 
00123   /// Disable automatic creation of MainWindow
00124   void DisableAutoMainWindow(){  fCreateMainWindow = false;}
00125 
00126   /// Get pointer to ODB variables
00127   VirtualOdb* GetODB(){return fODB;}
00128 
00129 
00130   /// Open output ROOT file
00131   void OpenRootFile(int run);
00132 
00133   /// Cloe output ROOT file
00134   void CloseRootFile();
00135   
00136   void DisableRootOutput(bool disable=true){fDisableRootOutput = disable;};
00137 
00138 protected:
00139 
00140   bool CreateOutputFile(std::string name, std::string options = "RECREATE"){
00141     
00142     fOutputFile = new TFile(name.c_str(),options.c_str());
00143     
00144     return true;
00145   }
00146 
00147 
00148   TRootanaEventLoop ();
00149 
00150   /// The static pointer to the singleton instance.
00151   static TRootanaEventLoop* fTRootanaEventLoop;
00152 
00153   /// TDirectory for online histograms.
00154   TDirectory* fOnlineHistDir;
00155 
00156 
00157 
00158 private:
00159   
00160   /// Help Message
00161   void PrintHelp();
00162 
00163   /// Output ROOT file
00164   TFile *fOutputFile;
00165 
00166   /// Variable for disabling/enabling Root output
00167   bool fDisableRootOutput;
00168 
00169   /// Pointer to the ODB access instance
00170   VirtualOdb* fODB;
00171  
00172   /// Are we processing offline or online data?
00173   bool fIsOffline;
00174 
00175   /// Current run number
00176   int fCurrentRunNumber;
00177 
00178 
00179   /// Pointer to the physics event; the physics event is what we pass to user.
00180   /// The midas event is accessible through physics event.
00181   /// We make a single instance of the physics event for whole execution,
00182   /// because sometimes the decoded information needs to persist 
00183   /// across multiple midas events.
00184   TDataContainer *fDataContainer;
00185

00188   // Variables for online analysis

00191   // ________________________________________________
00192   // Variables for offline analysis
00193   int fMaxEvents;
00194 
00195   // The TApplication...
00196   TApplication *fApp;
00197 
00198   // Should we automatically create a Main Window?
00199   bool fCreateMainWindow;
00200

00202 };
